pull.title: build: Bump VS minimum supported version to 18.3
pull.body:
The new [VS 18.0](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/releases/2026/release-notes) release includes numerous bug fixes.

Bumped to v18.3.0 where [this](https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/issues/22074) bug in the builtin vcpkg is [fixed](https://github.com/microsoft/vcpkg/issues/22074#issuecomment-3880320585).

events.body: The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers. ### Code Coverage & Benchmarks For details see: https://corecheck.dev/bitcoin/bitcoin/pulls/33861. ### Reviews See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process. | Type | Reviewers | | ---- | --------- | | Stale ACK | [maflcko](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/33861#issuecomment-3859093351) | If your review is incorrectly listed, please copy-paste <!--meta-tag:bot-skip--> into the comment that the bot should ignore. ### Conflicts Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones: * [#34500](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34500) (ci: Print verbose Windows CI build failure by maflcko) * [#31974](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/31974) (Drop testnet3 by Sjors) If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
Seems a bit premature, if this is still waiting for multiple pieces of unreleased software? Could just wait for it to be shown as fixed in a nightly build?

I guess there's no issue here with us assuming everyone compiling/developing on Windows is using an editor that is < 3 months old (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/releases/2026/release-notes#november-update-1800)?

Also, according to #34515 this software is broken:
> Also, moving to Visual Studio 2026 (Community edition) is currently not an option, it ships with a [unusable vcpkg version](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/10998815).

but I guess this doesn't effect us, or at least our usage in CI?

> Also, according to #34515 this software is broken:
> 
> > Also, moving to Visual Studio 2026 (Community edition) is currently not an option, it ships with a [unusable vcpkg version](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/t/10998815).
> 
> but I guess this doesn't effect us, or at least our usage in CI?

It [affects](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/34515#issuecomment-3861729236) the builtin vcpkg that is recommended in our [docs](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/build-windows-msvc.md). The CI uses an alternative vcpkg installation.

Converted to draft.
Rebased to resolve a conflict with merged bitcoin/bitcoin#34500.

events.message:
refactor: Remove workaround for resolved MSVC bug

The bug was fixed in Visual Studio 18.0.

rename.from: build: Bump VS minimum supported version to 18.0
rename.to: build: Bump VS minimum supported version to 18.3

events.body:
> I guess there's no issue here with us assuming everyone compiling/developing on Windows is using an editor that is < 3 months old (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/visualstudio/releases/2026/release-notes#november-update-1800)?

It shouldn't be a blocker, as Visual Studio supports side-by-side installations. Anyone who needs VS 2022 can keep it installed alongside the new version.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -219,10 +219,10 @@ jobs:
         include:
           - job-type: standard
             generate-options: '-DBUILD_BENCH=ON -DBUILD_KERNEL_LIB=ON -DBUILD_UTIL_CHAINSTATE=ON -DWERROR=ON'
-            job-name: 'Windows native, VS 2022'
+            job-name: 'Windows native, VS 2026'
           - job-type: fuzz
             generate-options: '-DVCPKG_MANIFEST_NO_DEFAULT_FEATURES=ON -DVCPKG_MANIFEST_FEATURES="wallet" -DBUILD_GUI=OFF -DWITH_ZMQ=OFF -DBUILD_FOR_FUZZING=ON -DWERROR=ON'
-            job-name: 'Windows native, fuzz, VS 2022'
+            job-name: 'Windows native, fuzz, VS 2026'
comments.body: could remove the version/year here, as the docs and presets should already be clear on it? (no other ci task is having the version/year in the title)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -97,7 +97,7 @@ cmake -B build --preset vs2022-static -DVCPKG_INSTALLED_DIR="C:\path_without_spa
 One can skip vcpkg manifest default features to speedup the configuration step.
comments.body: speedup -> speed up [verb phrase should be two words ("speed up") rather than the noun "speedup"; the current form is nonstandard in this context and may hinder clarity]
